definitions.definition: A hollow place or cavity; an excavation; a pit; a dent; a depression; a fissure.
examples: I made a blind hole in the wall for a peg. I dug a hole and planted a tree in it.

definitions.definition: An opening that goes all the way through a solid body, a fabric, etc.; a perforation; a rent.
examples: There’s a hole in my shoe. Her stocking has a hole in it.

subdefinitions.definition: A subsurface standard-size hole, also called cup , hitting the ball into which is the object of play. Each hole, of which there are usually eighteen as the standard on a full course, is located on a prepared surface, called the green , of a particular type grass.
The part of a game in which a player attempts to hit the ball into one of the holes.
examples: I played 18 holes yesterday. The second hole today cost me three strokes over par.

subdefinitions.definition: The rear portion of the defensive team between the shortstop and the third baseman.
examples: The shortstop ranged deep into the hole to make the stop.

subdefinitions.definition: A square on the board , with some positional significance , that a player does not, and cannot in the future, control with a friendly pawn .
A card (also called a hole card ) dealt face down thus unknown to all but its holder; the status in which such a card is.
In the game of fives , part of the floor of the court between the step and the pepperbox .

definitions.definition: A weakness ; a flaw or ambiguity .
examples: I have found a hole in your argument.

definitions.definition: In semiconductors , a lack of an electron in an occupied band behaving like a positively charged particle .
A security vulnerability in software which can be taken advantage of by an exploit .
Any bodily orifice , in particular the anus .
Solitary confinement , a high-security prison cell often used as punishment.
An undesirable place to live or visit.

examples: If you find yourself in a hole , stop digging.

definitions.definition: A chordless cycle in a graph .
A passing loop ; a siding provided for trains traveling in opposite directions on a single-track line to pass each other.
examples: We’re supposed to take the hole at Cronk and wait for the Limited to pass.

main_definition: A hollow place or cavity; an excavation; a pit; a dent; a depression; a fissure.
secondary_definitions: An opening that goes all the way through a solid body, a fabric, etc.; a perforation; a rent.
( archaeology , slang ) An excavation pit or trench.
( figuratively ) A weakness ; a flaw or ambiguity .
( physics ) In semiconductors , a lack of an electron in an occupied band behaving like a positively charged particle .
( computing ) A security vulnerability in software which can be taken advantage of by an exploit .
( slang ) Any bodily orifice , in particular the anus .
( informal , with "the" ) Solitary confinement , a high-security prison cell often used as punishment.
( slang ) An undesirable place to live or visit.
( graph theory ) A chordless cycle in a graph .
( slang , rail transport ) A passing loop ; a siding provided for trains traveling in opposite directions on a single-track line to pass each other.
( Canada , US , historical ) A mountain valley .
